alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 6:09PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Cherry and west central Brown Counties through 700 PM CDT/600 PM MDT/... At 608 PM CDT/508 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Nenzel to 7 miles east of Merritt Reservoir to near Brownlee. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Cody, Kilgore, Nenzel, Brownlee, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Crookston, Wood Lake, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River, Anderson Bridge State Wildlife Management Area, Smith Falls State Park, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River, Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area and Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 160 and 228. Highway 97 between mile markers 119 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 169 and 222. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT/800 PM MDT/ for north central Nebraska.
